landmark.translation[0].definitions[0].d: something that is easy to recognize, such as a tall tree or building, and that helps you know where you are
landmark.translation[0].definitions[0].e: One of Belfastâ€™s most famous landmarks, the Grosvenor Hall, has been demolished.
landmark.translation[0].definitions[1].d: one of the most important events, changes, or discoveries that influences someone or something
landmark.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The discovery of penicillin was a landmark in the history of medicine.
The Supreme Court issued a landmark decision in January 2001.
landmark.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: The Eiffel Tower is probably the most famous landmark in Paris.
Rome is crammed with historic landmarks such as the Colosseum.
The castle sits on a hill above the town and is a prominent landmark.
It was so dark we could not see any familiar landmarks.
This oddly shaped rock is a well-known local landmark.
From Parliament Hill, you can see most of London's major landmarks.
Buckingham Palace is a London Landmark.
landmark.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a landmark agreement, decision, settlement etc is one that is very important and influences how other things develop
landmark.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The company won landmark settlements against several competitors from Japan and South Korea.
